Kafka service properties

properties.label: log.retention.bytes
properties.description: The maximum size of the log before deleting it

properties.label: log.retention.hours
properties.description: The number of hours to keep a log file before deleting it (in hours)

properties.label: log.segment.bytes
properties.description: The maximum size of the segment of log

properties.label: log.segment.delete.delay.ms
properties.description: The time of delay to delete segment log

properties.label: log.roll.hours
properties.description: The number of hours to keep a log file before roll it to segment

properties.label: auto.create.topics.enable
properties.description: Enable auto creation of topic on the server

properties.label: default.replication.factor
properties.description: default replication factors for automatically created topics

properties.label: delete.topic.enable
properties.description: Enables delete topic. Delete topic through the admin tool will have no effect if this config is turned off

properties.label: offsets.topic.replication.factor
properties.description: The replication factor for the offsets topic (set higher to ensure availability). Internal topic creation will fail until the cluster size meets this replication factor requirement

properties.label: log.cleanup.policy
properties.description: This string designates the retention policy to use on old log segments

properties.label: log.cleaner.enable
properties.description: use to compact messages

properties.label: compression.type
properties.description: Specify the final compression type for a given topic

properties.label: message.max.bytes
properties.description: This is largest message size Kafka will allow to be appended to this topic

properties.label: num.io.threads
properties.description: The number of io threads that the server uses for carrying out network requests

properties.label: num.partitions
properties.description: The default number of log partitions per topic

properties.label: num.replica.fetchers
properties.description: Number of fetcher threads used to replicate messages from a source broker

properties.label: queued.max.requests
properties.description: The number of queued requests allowed before blocking the network threads

properties.label: socket.receive.buffer.bytes
properties.description: The SO_RCVBUF buffer of the socket sever sockets

properties.label: socket.send.buffer.bytes
properties.description: The SO_SNDBUF buffer of the socket sever sockets

properties.label: unclean.leader.election.enable
properties.description: Indicates whether to enable replicas not in the ISR set to be elected as leader as a last resort, even though doing so may result in data loss

properties.label: advertised.host.name
properties.description: This is the hostname that will be given out to other workers to connect to.

properties.label: advertised.port
properties.description: This is the port that will be given out to other workers to connect to

properties.label: kafka-manager.basicAuthentication.enabled
properties.description: Choose whether or not need to log in kafka-manager

properties.label: kafka-manager.basicAuthentication.username
properties.description: This is the username that log in kafka-manager

properties.label: kafka-manager.basicAuthentication.password
properties.description: This is the password that log in kafka-manager

properties.label: kafka-manager.port
properties.description: This is the kafka-manager http port
